title: Ticket #6891: job ads do not specify which tokens should be transferred
description:
When a user submits a job that requires (or is provided) tokens, nothing is added to the job ad that says what (1) tokens the job requested and/or (2) what tokens the starter should request from the shadow. This is a problem because:
  1. a user may want to query or edit jobs based on their token requests, and
  2. the shadow sends all of a user's tokens to the starter from the submit machine because there is no way for the starter and/or shadow to know which tokens a job needs.

We should limit the tokens a user's job has access to to only those tokens the job needs. (This could include tokens not explicitly requested in a user's submit file if tokens are automatically being generated for each job, see OSG's scitoken workflow for example.)

CODE REVIEW: LGTM. Note for when we get around to documenting token mode, the OAuthServicesNeeded attr in the job ad is a StringList with each token name stored as Provider*Handle, not as Provider_Handle, which allows the admin to include underscores in the provider name in the config. This is good as, for example, a pool could be configured with multiple scitokens clients.
